thread.title: MSU's LJ Scott rushes to second Big Ten honor
thread.title_full: MSU's LJ Scott rushes to second Big Ten honor

author: detroitnews.com
title: MSU's LJ Scott rushes to second Big Ten honor
text:
LJ Scott (Photo: Dale G. Young, Detroit News) 
13 CONNECT 7 TWEET LINKEDIN 1 COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
East Lansing – Michigan State running back LJ Scott was named the Big Ten Freshman of the Week on Monday, the second time he has earned the honor this season.
Scott ran for 146 yards on 18 carries and scored two touchdowns in Saturday’s victory over Purdue. It was the first career 100-yard game for Scott and the second time this season he has scored twice in a game, the first coming in the Week 2 victory over Oregon.
“LJ Scott had a big day for us,” co-offensive coordinator and running backs coach Dave Warner said. “His vision and patience with the ball in his hands are improving each week. LJ again showed his strength, as he rushed for 87 yards after contact.”
Scott scored on runs of 18 and one yard in the first quarter against the Boilermakers and his 146 yards were the most by a Michigan State freshman since Javon Ringer ran for 194 against Illinois on Sept. 24, 2005.
Scott leads the Spartans in rushing with 376 yards on 61 carries (6.2-yard average) through five games, and his four rushing TDs also rank first on the team.
No. 4 Michigan State (5-0, 1-0 Big Ten) travels to Rutgers (2-2, 0-1) for an 8 p.m. kickoff this Saturday.
Iowa linebacker Desmond King, a junior from Detroit East English Village, was named Co-Defensive Player of the Week after getting nine tackles and two interceptions in the Hawkeyes' win at Wisconsin.
BIG TEN WEEKLY AWARDS 
Offensive Player of the Week: RB Ezekiel Elliott, Ohio State
Co-Defensive Players of the Week: DB Desmond King, Iowa, and LB Joe Schobert, Wisconsin
Special Teams Player of the Week: P Sam Foltz, Nebraska
Freshman of the Week: RB LJ Scott, Michigan State
